metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46874 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A file with a long filename could have had its filename truncated to remove the valid extension, leaving a malicious extension in its place. This could potentially led to user confusion and the execution of malicious code.
*Note*: This issue was originally included in the advisories for Thunderbird 102.6, but a patch (specific to Thunderbird) was omitted, resulting in it actually being fixed in Thunderbird 102.6.1. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108, Thunderbird < 102.6.1, Thunderbird < 102.6, and Firefox ESR < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
